question_text: What is the key difference between single data rate (SDR) and double data rate (DDR) memory?
answer_options: DDR uses less voltage than SDR
DDR transfers data on both rising and falling edges of the clock cycle
SDR has more capacity per module
DDR can only be used in servers
correct_answer: DDR transfers data on both rising and falling edges of the clock cycle
explanation: DDR (Double Data Rate) memory can transfer data on both edges of a clock cycle, effectively doubling the data transfer rate over SDR memory.
